intro: Asterogyne yaracuyense, commonly known as the Yaracuyense arrowleaf, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of Venezuela. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its distinctive arrow-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are typically borne on slender peduncles. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
